author: mpaulucci
content: Hi, looking at the consensus specs I see there are two ways to sending an attestation: inside a block, or outside a block via gossip. I'm not sure understand what is the benefit of allowing an attestation to be sent outside a block? Is it for the case when a producer fails to produce a block? Is it fair to assume that the vast mayority of attestations come inside a block?

author: 0xunclebill
content:
https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/consensus-mechanisms/pos/attestations/

from what I understand from this article, attestations are passed around via gossip and when a validator is selected to be a block proposer they package all those attestations into a new block

so it seems to me that all  attestations are first sent via gossip, and then packaged by the block proposer into a block
